page.title: 17Religion
page.content: The oldest place of worship in Saughall is the Methodist Chapel (Ebenezer) which was begun in 1864 and completed a year later. The present minister is Malcom Maymond, and the Church worships at 11 a.m on Sundays and holds a simultaneous Sunday School. There is a regular midweek fellowship meeting. Saughall Parish church (All Saints) is decorated with colourful stained glass windows.The church is of Ruabon red brick with a slate roof and was completed in 1901. The present vicar is Geoffrey Robinson. There are three services each Sunday and a morning Sunday School. There is also a midweek service and a variety of activities including Women's Fellowship, Men's Society, Mothers Union, Fellowship Group and CHUGS (youth group).
